alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Knott; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 12:25AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, Letcher, southeastern Knott and southwestern Pike Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1225 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from May to Defeated Creek to Evarts. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Letcher, Kings Creek, Flint, Ivan, Deane, Omaha, Democrat, Oscaloosa, Roxana and May around 1230 AM EDT. Whitesburg, Fleming-Neon, Day, Dongola, Ice, Oven Fork, Whitco, Trailer, Marlowe and Ehkhorn Mine around 1235 AM EDT. Ermine, Colly, Speight, Mayking, Eolia, Clover, Sergent, Bellcraft, Winters and Beefhide around 1240 AM EDT. Lynch, Jonancy, Rock House, Clover Fork, Myra, Big Black Mountain, Dorton, Wright, Thornton and Whitaker around 1245 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Jenkins, Payne Gap, Fishpond Lake, Potters Fork, Dunham, Haymond, Lowndes, Lookout, Gaskill, Burdine, Adamson, Ashcamp, Shelby Gap, Elkhorn City and Cedarville. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 7. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
